meanings.sent1: The chirt of the bird caught my attention.
meanings.sent2: I heard a chirt coming from the bushes.
meanings.sent3: The chirt of the squirrel made me smile.
meanings.sent4: The chirt of the kettle signaled it was ready.
meanings.sent5: The chirt of the wind through the leaves was soothing.

meanings.definition: To make a short, sharp, high-pitched sound
meanings.sent1: The cricket began to chirt in the evening.
meanings.sent2: I tried to chirt like a bird but failed.
meanings.sent3: The teapot started to chirt as it boiled.
meanings.sent4: The old door would chirt whenever it opened.
meanings.sent5: The excited puppy would chirt happily.

meanings.definition: A small, sharp stone or pebble
meanings.sent1: She picked up a chirt to skip on the water.
meanings.sent2: The children collected colorful chirts from the beach.
meanings.sent3: The annoying chirt in my shoe bothered me all day.
meanings.sent4: The path was covered with tiny chirts.
meanings.sent5: He accidentally stepped on a sharp chirt.
